docblock.description: Handles all pt testing tasks, except for handling uploaded csv pt test files

$_POST capid the person (text) tester the capid of the tester *TEST_CODE* the input for the CPFT test (text) search clicking on search for jumping to member search (submit) save saves the input (submit) *capid* the pass/fail of the member pass=passed fail=failed (radio) waive[$i]=*capid* waiving the cpft for the capid (checkbox)

$_SESSION date- the date of the test achiev- the achievement an individual test is for capid- the capid of the testee tester- the capid of the tester

docblock.description: Displays the home page for the login section.
docblock.long-description:
Also displays notifications of important things such as test sign ups and security breaches These notifications are based on the tasks they are able to use. This uses a class which content is created from a csv outside the document root

No Inputs

docblock.description: Compares notifications to sort by presidence

tag.name: param
tag.description: first one

tag.name: param
tag.description: second one

tag.name: return
tag.description: standard usort method returns

docblock.description: The class for notifications for a user.
docblock.long-description:
The notifications are associated with a staff task from the table TASKS these are the pages the staff allowed to see. If a staff member has permissions for that task he will have that notication.

The display string of the text has a special syntax. Any normal text will be simply displayed to display a query result enclose the column name (if renamed use the renamed column name) in ** Only the first row (0) will be used

if the column name contains DATE it will be parsed as a dateTime, and will follow the display constants for this project

i.e. There are COUNT testing requests There was a request by REQUEST_NAME to clear the system log on DATE.

Presidence scale: 0-3 0: high priority- security breech 1: System administration needed 2:High-priority membership administration 3:low-priority membership administration

docblock.description: Creates a new notification object
docblock.long-description: WARNING:INPUT cannot be cleaned because queries are being parsed. Do not create a notification from user input, use ONLY input from the csv file

tag.name: param
tag.description: -the query to run

tag.name: param
tag.description: text - the text to be displayed with special syntax * The display string of the text has a special syntax. Any normal text will be simply displayed to display a query result enclose the column name (if renamed use the renamed column name) in ** Only the first row (0) will be used if the column name contains DATE it will be parsed as a dateTime, and will follow the display constants for this project i.e. There are *COUNT* testing requests There was a request by *REQUEST_NAME* to clear the system log on *DATE*.

tag.name: param
tag.description: - the presidence of the notification 0-3 scale

tag.name: param
tag.description: -the task code for this notification from the database

docblock.description: Checks if this notification has anything to display.
docblock.long-description:
It also runs the query and preps for the display.

WARNING: Do not use the User's database connection use the sandboxed one instead. These will be executing queries that may be tampered with.

tag.name: param
tag.description: the database connection of the SANDBOXED user

tag.name: return
tag.description: true if this will be displayed, false otherwise

docblock.description: Displays the actual link if it needs to

tag.name: param
tag.description: the database connection

docblock.description: Checks if an account is locked from too many bad logins Checks ACCOUNT_LOCKS and LOGIN_LOG
docblock.long-description: This will first if their is ACCOUNT_LOCK in place already from said table, and verifies the lock is still in effect. If there isn't one it checks the number of bad logins,and will place a block Uses the constant MAX_LOGIN for the maximum number of logins in the time from LOCK_TIME

tag.description: the user's CAPID you are checking

tag.name: return
tag.description: true if there is no lock false if there is a lock

docblock.description: CleanInputInt-cleans input number
docblock.long-description:
This cleans input numbers against SQL injection, XSS, and remote Execution and file traversing. It uses the mysqli_real_escape_string htmlspecialchars, and escapshellcmd to do this. It also checks length, and parses it as a number to prevent other issues. Any issues and the event will be logged along with the sanatized form of the input

This

tag.name: param
tag.description: the raw Input

tag.name: param
tag.description: the absolue length or maximum lenght the number must be, depending on $exact

tag.name: param
tag.description: the name of the input field used for logging

tag.name: param
tag.description: true for $length to be exact false for $length to be the max length

tag.name: return
tag.description: The Input Number parsed and cleaned as a floating point

docblock.description: Cleans an input String
docblock.long-description: See cleanInputInt for how it cleans the text

tag.name: param
tag.description: The raw input

tag.name: param
tag.description: the maximum allowed length

tag.name: param
tag.description: the field name to be logged

tag.name: param
tag.description: false if the String can't be empty, true if it can be empty

tag.name: param
tag.description: true if needs to clean against shell characters

tag.name: return
tag.description: returns the cleaned text

docblock.description: Cleans an input text and matches its pattern against a regular expression
docblock.long-description: See CleanInputInt for how the text is cleaned, except this does not use cleanShellargs()

tag.name: param
tag.description: the Raw input

tag.name: param
tag.description: the regular expression to check the pattern against

tag.name: param
tag.description: the maximum length of the field

tag.name: param
tag.description: the field name for logging purposed

tag.name: return
tag.description: the cleaned input or null if it doesn't match the regex or is too long

docblock.description: A function to verify uploaded files.
docblock.long-description: This verifies the proper data type, and that file was uploaded. Checks for malicious code. Saves the file in the specified directory with a new name, a md5hash and the timestamp. It also will handle any upload errors

tag.name: param
tag.description: the index for the file in the $_FILES array

tag.name: param
tag.description: the maximum size of the file in bytes

tag.name: param
tag.description: the directory to save the file in

tag.name: param
tag.description: the mime type of the accepted file type

tag.name: return
tag.description: the URL to the saved file or false if there was an error or attack

docblock.description: Starts a session, and checks for foul play
docblock.long-description:
This checks first for session hijacking by checking the request is from the right IP address, it will also update the session key. It will then check if the user is allowed to view this page using a list from session_predict_path. If there is a threat it will force the user to resign in.

Uses the following Session variables ip_addr= the ip_address to be used predicted- the pages the user can see last- the last visited page -request - an array of the last used request header -agent- the user agent -accept- the accept header -lang_char- the accepted language and charset -encoding- the accepted encoding - resignin- force user to resign in 0 - must resignin 1- another request

tag.name: param
tag.description: the capid of the user for creating the session should be used only by /login/index.php

docblock.description: Creates an array of pages the user is allowed to see.
docblock.long-description: The pages the user has permissions are added. Then pages that are allowed to be seen after the page the user is on. i.e. the page to confirm a member deletion from the member delete page.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The databse connection of user ViewNext

tag.name: param
tag.description: The user we're looking at only for establishing sessions

tag.name: param
tag.description: The page to create the list for if not the current page

docblock.description: Forces a user to resign in if there is a threat against their session.

tag.name: param
tag.description: allowSignIn false won't resign in just show dead session true allows to resign in

docblock.description: Destroys the user session.
docblock.long-description: And logs the log off.

docblock.description: Creates a input for entering a date

tag.name: param
tag.description: true to have all the inputs inline, false stacks them

docblock.description: Searchs for an event from the display_event_search_in()

tag.name: param
tag.description: the function to call on a single result

tag.name: param
tag.description: the link to go to if there are mutliple results

docblock.description: A custom usort function for sorting promotion requests
docblock.long-description: Sorts the requests based upon which member has the least amount of requirements completed it is based 1the number of incomplete requirements+.5 the number of in-progress tasks

tag.name: param

tag.name: param
tag.description: the second item

tag.name: return
tag.description: 0 if they are equal 1 if a is less -1 if a is greater

docblock.description: Verifies a password meets password requirements

tag.name: param
tag.description: true to check the old password, false if this the first password

tag.name: return
tag.description: 0=>boolean, true passed, false otherwise, 1=>the password on success,1+=> the error message(s) otherwise each message it's own index

docblock.description: A class for CAP members
docblock.long-description:
It holds all the functions, and data for members. The amount of Data held is based on the init levels

init levels : -1= all from input 0=capid 1=capid+name+gender+achievement 2=1+text+member_type+picture 3=2+dates 4=3+emergency+unit

docblock.description: Creaes the member object

tag.name: param
tag.description: string $capid the capid of the member

tag.name: param
tag.description: the init level to start at, -1 if you want to enter the data and not get it from the database

tag.description: the database connection

tag.name: param
tag.description: the Last name

tag.name: param
tag.description: The first name

tag.name: param
tag.description: the gender of the member

tag.name: param
tag.description: the member's date of birth

tag.description: the member's member type

tag.description: the member's current achievement

tag.name: param
tag.description: the member's textbook set

tag.name: param
tag.description: the member's home unit

tag.name: param
tag.description: the date the member joined

tag.description: the array of the requirement_types from the header section

tag.description: whether or not to show as a whole promotion report, false will show name in the row, true won't

docblock.description: Creates a password hash.
docblock.long-description: Creates a SHA512 hash from the password, salted with the member's capid, and the passed salt.

tag.description: the password to create a hash from

tag.name: param
tag.description: the salt to add to the password

tag.name: return
tag.description: 128 digit hash

docblock.description: Verifies the user provided the right password
docblock.long-description: Uses member::has_password() to create a password hash, and compares it to the hash in the member table

tag.description: the database connection

tag.name: param
tag.description: the password to check

tag.name: param
tag.description: the system salt

tag.name: return
tag.description: true if it matches false otherwise

docblock.description: A secure way to see pictures on the server
docblock.long-description:
All sensetive pictures (profile pictures) go through here so only people who should see pictures can prevents from wandering through the pictures without a logon
